title: Major Chords
description: Learn to play C, F, and G major chords — the three most important chords in the key of C.

steps.title: What is a Major Chord?
steps.description: A major chord is made of three notes: the root, the major 3rd (4 semitones up), and the perfect 5th (7 semitones up). Major chords sound bright and happy. The three chords C, F, and G are the primary chords in the key of C major.

steps.title: Play C Major
steps.description: Play C, E, and G together to form a C major chord.

steps.title: Play F Major
steps.description: Play F, A, and C together to form an F major chord.

steps.title: Play G Major
steps.description: Play G, B, and D together to form a G major chord.

steps.title: The I-IV-V Progression
steps.description: C, F, and G are the I, IV, and V chords in the key of C. This I-IV-V pattern is the backbone of countless songs in rock, pop, blues, and country music. Try playing them in order: C → F → G → C.

steps.title: Back to C Major
steps.description: Play the C major chord one more time. Notice how it feels like 'coming home' after playing F and G.

steps.title: Major Chord Quiz
